item.title: Jackie add a quote by Epicurus
item.description: "The wealth required by nature is limited and is easy to procure; but the wealth required by vain ideals extends to infinity." -- Epicurus

item.title: Jackie add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "Among other things, you'll find that you're not the first person who was ever confused and frightened and even sickened by human behavior. You're by no means alone on that score, you'll be excited and stimulated to know. Many, many men have been just as troubled morally and spiritually as you are right now. Happily, some of them kept records of their troubles. You'll learn from themâ€”if you want to. Just as someday, if you have something to offer, someone will learn something from you. It's a beautiful reciprocal arrangement. And it isn't education. It's history. It's poetry." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Jackie add a quote by Mark Rothko
item.description: "When I was a younger man, art was a lonely thing. No galleries, no collectors, no critics, no money. Yet, it was a golden age, for we all had nothing to lose and a vision to gain. Today it is not quite the same. It is a time of tons of verbiage, activity, consumption. Which condition is better for the world at large I shall not venture to discuss. But I do know, that many of those who are driven to this life are desperately searching for those pockets of silence where we can root and grow. We must all hope we find them." -- Mark Rothko

item.title: Jackie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Many a true word hath been spoken in jest." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Jackie add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "As Freud has shown, blunders are not the merest chance. They are the result of suppressed desires and conflicts. They are ripples on the surface of life, produced by unsuspected springs. And these may be very deep - as deep as the soul itself. The blunder may amount to the opening of a destiny." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Jackie add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "I would say that all our sciences are the material that has to be mythologized. A mythology gives spiritual import - what one might call rather the psychological, inward import, of the world of nature round about us, as understood today. There's no real conflict between science and religion ... What is in conflict is the science of 2000 BC ... and the science of the 20th century AD." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Jackie add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Once you have tasted flight, you will forever walk the earth with your eyes turned skyward, for there you have been, and there you will always long to return." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Jackie add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Nothing can be loved or hated unless it is first understood." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Jackie add a quote by Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi
item.description: "Forget safety. Live where you fear to live. Destroy your reputation. Be notorious." -- Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

item.title: Jackie add a quote by Kurt Cobain
item.description: "Nobody dies a virgin... Life fucks us all." -- Kurt Cobain

item.title: Jackie add a quote by Mark Rothko
item.description: "I'm not an abstractionist. I'm not interested in the relationship of color or form or anything else. I'm interested only in expressing basic human emotions: tragedy, ecstasy, doom, and so on." -- Mark Rothko

item.title: Jackie add a quote by Kurt Cobain
item.description: "Birds scream at the top of their lungs in horrified hellish rage every morning at daybreak to warn us all of the truth, but sadly we don't speak bird." -- Kurt Cobain
